sense.name: Have to do with or be relevant to.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 2: in Sense 1, object must be abstract.
sense.examples: French became the language of law and government, of war and of all that pertained to the life of the wealthier classes. My remark pertained to you earlier comments.

sense.name: Be a part or attribute of; be under the ownership of.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 1: in Sense 2, object must be concrete.
sense.examples: And there came an angel of the LORD, and sat under an oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained unto Joash the Abiezrite. She pertains to me and I to her. That dog pertains to an excellent breed.
